column4: i just switched to the nvidia driver, and after restarting X all of my fonts are really big. i assume its using a larger dpi. any idea how to fix it ?
is it possible to mount a directory/cdrom as a .iso file ? (not the reverse of mounting a .iso file as a cdrom) ?
that would have nothing to do with mount
mkisofs will create an iso image for you
: but that will create a new byte for byte file, right ? i have a 16 GB partition and i want to reference it as a .iso, but i dont really want to make a .iso out of it
why would you want to do that?
: qemu
that sounds gross
why a .iso?
: well doesn't have to be a .iso, just any format i can pass to "-hda filename"
if i recall correctly, you are running vmware in breezy, right ?
yes
whenever i try to go into snapshot manager, vmware dies. do you experience this same problem ?
is it oopsing your kernel?
nope, haven't had that issue since i installed using any2any
ah, dunno then, sorry
: snapshot manager works just fine for you then i take it ?
laptop-net does things like that
ill give it a try, thanks
yes
has anybody else reported issues where they run "sudo command" where command can be anything, and it just hangs? i keep getting that intermittently
launchpad.net
that drops you into a rot shell without asking for a password
